com.powerup.logic

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.powerup.logic.Board

  • public final class Board
extends Object
    The game's board, responsible for maintaining tiles.
    Since:
    2014-01-22
    Author:
    Oliver Lewisohn

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board(Game game)
      Creates 100 tiles and sets up a random integer generator.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(Game game)
        Creates 100 tiles and sets up a random integer generator.
        Parameters:
        game - The game.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllConnectedTiles

        public ArrayList<Tile> getAllConnectedTiles(Tile tile)
        Finds all the connecting tiles of a given tile.

        This differs from getNeighbours in that it also finds the neighbours of all the original tile's neighbours, all their neighbours, and so on.

        Parameters:
        tile - The tile whose connecting tiles are to be fetched.
        Returns:
        A list containing every tile connected to the parameter tile.

      • getCompanyNeighbours

        public ArrayList<Company> getCompanyNeighbours(Tile tile)
        Fetches the companies which own tiles neighbouring the parameter tile.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile to be checked.
        Returns:
        A list of companies which own tiles neighbouring the parameter tile.

      • getHighlightedTile

        public Tile getHighlightedTile()

      • getNeighbours

        public ArrayList<Tile> getNeighbours(Tile tile)
        Fetches the neighbouring tiles, if they have been played, of the parameter tile.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile whose neighbours are to be fetched.
        Returns:
        A list containing the played neighbours of the parameter tile.

      • getNeutralNeighbours

        public int getNeutralNeighbours(Tile tile)
        Finds out how many neutral tiles neighbour the parameter tile. A neutral tile is defined as a tile which is not owned by any company.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile to be checked.

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int x,
           int y)
        Gets a tile by its x and y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the tile to be fetched.
        y - The y-coordinate of the tile to be fetched.
        Returns:
        The desired tile, providing the coordinates are within range.

      • getTiles

        public ArrayList<ArrayList<Tile>> getTiles()

      • getRandomUnassignedTile

        public Tile getRandomUnassignedTile()
        Gets a random tile which is not yet on the board or in a player's hand.
        Returns:
        A new random tile.

      • giveTileToPlayer

        public void giveTileToPlayer(Player player)
        Puts a random unassigned tile in a player's hand.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to receive the tile.

      • giveTileToPlayer

        public void giveTileToPlayer(Player player,
                    Tile tile)
        Puts a specific tile in a player's hand.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to receive the tile.
        tile - The tile to be given.

      • playTileToBoard

        public boolean playTileToBoard(Tile tile)
        Plays a given tile to the board.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile to be played.
        Returns:
        False if the tile was already on the board, otherwise true.

      • recursivelyAddTilesToCompany

        public void recursivelyAddTilesToCompany(Company company,
                                Tile tile)
        Adds a tile and all its neighbouring tiles to a company.
        Parameters:
        company -
        tile -

      • refillPlayerHand

        public void refillPlayerHand(Player player)
        Refills a player's hand to size five, providing enough tiles remain.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to receive the tiles.

      • setHighlightedTile

        public void setHighlightedTile(Tile tile)

      • unassignedTilesRemaining

        public int unassignedTilesRemaining()
        Finds out how many tiles are not yet on the board or in a player's hand.
        Returns:
        The number of tiles remaining in the "bank".
